contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Osterizer.jpg|right|thumb|275px|''Osterizer'' single speed "beehive" blender]] '''Osterizer''' is a [[brand]] which has been used by [[John Oster Manufacturing Company|Oster Manufacturing]] for its line of [[blender (device)|blender]]s since 1946. It is claimed to be the first mainstream brand of blender,<ref>Young</ref> though technically the [[Waring Products|Waring]] blender ''brand'' was introduced in 1937. In 1946, Oster had bought the [[Stevens Electric Company]], which had received a patent on the liquifying blender in 1922. Oster itself was bought by [[Sunbeam Corporation]] in 1980. Osterizers tended towards heavy construction and motors. While this raised cost, many early-model Osterizers still function today, and are more powerful than a majority of contemporary consumer blenders.{{Fact|date=May 2007}} Oster Platinum Face 60-Minute Timer celebrates 80th Anniversary on December 2010 to October 2011. ==Sources== * J.
